titleStmt.title: Certaine godly and learned expositions vpon diuers parts of Scripture As they were preached, and afterwards more briefly penned by that vvorthy man of God, Maister George Estey, sometimes fellovve of Goneuill and Caius Colledge in Cambridge. Late preacher of the word of God in Saint Edmunds Burie.
titleStmt.author: Estey, George, 1560 or 61-1601.
Estey, George, 1560 or 61-1601. Most sweete and comfortable exposition, upon the tenne commaundements, and upon the 51. Psalme.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I[ames] R[oberts] for Richard Banckworth, and are to be sold in Paules Church-yard, at the signe of the Sunne,

notesStmt.note: Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: A-T⁴ V² ² A-2Q⁴.
"An exposition vppon the 51. Psalme" (B1r-V2v) is an amended reprint of Estey's "A most sweete and comfortable exposition, upon the tenne commaundements, and upon the 51. Psalme".
"An exposition vpon the Lords supper" (caption title) begins new register and pagination.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: Paules Church-yard, at the signe of the Sunne
